[The "Blood Trough Sister" incident set off the Internet: A woman had a car accident, and her aunt used her connections to get all civil servants to donate blood. The privileged rescue caused dissatisfaction among young people who were taking the civil service exam]
On the evening of November 28, a "Blood Trough Sister" suddenly caused a discussion on the Internet.
In the Douyin video she shot herself, she was in a car accident while traveling in Ali, Tibet. Then her aunt used her connections to contact the Shanghai Health Commission and mobilized all civil servants in the Ali Autonomous Region, police officers from the police station, firefighters, and soldiers from the army to donate blood for her, and said, "All the type A blood in the entire Ali Autonomous Region has been transfused to you."
She was even sent to Sichuan by charter flight, and then "all kinds of roads were opened" to send her to the hospital.
The whole process even became a positive energy news on the "Party Building Garden" of the hospital.
Once this video was spread, it caused young people who were taking the civil service exam to complain. Some netizens lamented: "Do we work hard to pass the civil service exam just to be mobile blood bags for you rich people? Our lives are also lives!"

content:
Follow-up
Currently, the "Blood Trough Sister" incident has become the most searched topic on Weibo
Her husband said that the online news was untrue and the chat records were meant to encourage his wife to survive. His aunt is not a public official. After the car accident, the local authorities suggested that the aunt and others find a way to contact the Shanghai Health Commission. The blood donation was organized by the local hospital and the Health Commission in Ali, and it was not an individual act.
As for "civil servants donating blood in the whole region", it was just the hospital staff who posted on WeChat Moments. He contacted the police station and the fire department himself, and there was no forced blood donation.
The reporter called the Shanghai Health Commission, and the other party said that they had received a letter from the relevant department at the time, requesting the doctors from Shigatse to go to treat the case, and that this matter did not involve personal relationships.
The husband said that the woman's original intention was just to record her experience of escaping death, and she was depressed after being accused, and she had already cried once.

"Every sentence is filled with tears, every word is full of tears"
On November 28, Yang Niuhua, a Guizhou woman who had been abducted for 26 years, denounced the trafficker Yu Huaying at the trial.
Yang Niuhua said: After being abducted, my mother became a lunatic and my father became an alcoholic. When I saw my mother again, I held her bones in my hands."

In 1995, Yang Niuhua, who was only 5 years old, was trafficked from Guiyang to Handan, Hebei by human trafficker Yu Huaying. Yang Niuhua's parents died of depression soon after because they could not bear the pain of losing their daughter. It was not until 28 years later that the delayed justice finally came and the human trafficker Yu Huaying was brought to court.

It is reported that from 1993 to 1996, Yu Huaying and her accomplices trafficked a total of 11 children for profit. In addition to these 11 children, she also sold her son and niece's children.

On September 18 this year, the Intermediate People's Court of Guiyang City, Guizhou Province, made a first-instance judgment on Yu Huaying's child trafficking case, and Yu Huaying was sentenced to death. Yu Huaying was dissatisfied with the death sentence and appealed in court.

The second trial of the case opened on the morning of November 28.
